byline.contributor: Richard Pérez-Peña and Timothy Williams contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and MITCH SMITH

abstract: Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel's sudden dismissal of Police Superintendent Garry F McCarthy reflects intensifying pressure and scrutiny over shooting of black teenager Laquan McDonald by Police Officer Jason Van Dyke and police department and city's handling of matter; Emanuel expresses support of McCarthy and approval of his work during his four years as superintendent before recent events.
lead_paragraph: The superintendent, Garry F. McCarthy, and his department came under pressure for resisting the release of a video showing an officer shooting a teenager 16 times.

headline.main: Mayor Rahm Emanuel Fires Chicago Police Superintendent
headline.print_headline: Top Officer Out as the Pressure Rises in Chicago

snippet: The superintendent, Garry F. McCarthy, and his department came under pressure for resisting the release of a video showing an officer shooting a teenager 16 times.
